docs.snippet: LEAD: The agent in charge of the Federal Drug Enforcement Administration in New York City and a top undercover agent for it are leaving the D.E.A. with harsh words about Federal drug policy, saying that it is ill conceived and that the Government's...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The agent in charge of the Federal Drug Enforcement Administration in New York City and a top undercover agent for it are leaving the D.E.A. with harsh words about Federal drug policy, saying that it is ill conceived and that the Government's operations abroad are futile.

headline.main: Retiring Agents Sharply Attack Drug Policies

docs.snippet: LEAD: In an era in which the cold war is ending, the Germanys are moving toward reunification and the South African Government has legalized the major black opposition, is it possible to resolve trade disputes with Japan?
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: In an era in which the cold war is ending, the Germanys are moving toward reunification and the South African Government has legalized the major black opposition, is it possible to resolve trade disputes with Japan?

byline.original: By CLYDE H. FARNSWORTH, Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: LEAD: The BellSouth Corporation announced that a consortium in which it is a major stake holder had won a 20-year franchise to build and operate a cellular telephone network in western Mexico.

docs.snippet: LEAD: Uruguay raised fuel prices and utility charges Tuesday by up to 30 percent and proposed an increase in taxes to slash its budget deficit and cut inflation. The measures should cut the deficit to 2.5 percent of gross domestic product from 8.5...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Uruguay raised fuel prices and utility charges Tuesday by up to 30 percent and proposed an increase in taxes to slash its budget deficit and cut inflation. The measures should cut the deficit to 2.5 percent of gross domestic product from 8.5 percent.

docs.snippet: LEAD: The Soviet Union has formally applied for observer status with the General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade, a spokesman for the 96-nation world trade forum said today.

docs.snippet: LEAD: To supporters' cheers and opponents' cries of ''murderer,'' Gen. Augusto Pinochet ended his last full day in power today with a call for national unity behind his elected successor.
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: To supporters' cheers and opponents' cries of ''murderer,'' Gen. Augusto Pinochet ended his last full day in power today with a call for national unity behind his elected successor.

headline.main: Cheers and Boos as Chilean Leader Says Goodbye

docs.snippet: LEAD: THERE are still two legs and some 12,000 miles to go in the six-leg, 33,000-mile Whitbread round-the-world yacht race, but by one measure the 22 boats representing four yacht classes and 13 nations have already sailed around the world, or an...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: THERE are still two legs and some 12,000 miles to go in the six-leg, 33,000-mile Whitbread round-the-world yacht race, but by one measure the 22 boats representing four yacht classes and 13 nations have already sailed around the world, or an icy chunk of it, anyway.

docs.snippet: LEAD: The long and often bitter era of military rule came to an end in Chile today with the installation of Patricio Aylwin, a genial Christian Democrat and longtime political figure, as the elected successor to Gen. Augusto Pinochet.
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The long and often bitter era of military rule came to an end in Chile today with the installation of Patricio Aylwin, a genial Christian Democrat and longtime political figure, as the elected successor to Gen. Augusto Pinochet.

byline.original: By SHIRLEY CHRISTIAN, Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: LEAD: One day this month, President Jose Sarney gave an old political ally a unusual birthday present: the chance to be president of Brazil for a day.

headline.main: In Brazil, Scathing Criticism For the Departing President

byline.original: By JAMES BROOKE, Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: LEAD: Investigate before you invest has long been a watchword on Wall Street. But when it comes to buying a retirement home, particularly in a distant state or country, the purchase is all too often made site unseen. Others travel to the area they...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Investigate before you invest has long been a watchword on Wall Street. But when it comes to buying a retirement home, particularly in a distant state or country, the purchase is all too often made site unseen. Others travel to the area they are interested in and see only real-estate salespeople.

headline.main: Planning for Retirement, and Enjoying It
